analysis.Summary: Vue component that displays a user’s blog posts section on their profile page. It shows a header with a “create post” button (when viewing own profile), a tab selector for filtering posts (My posts, Drafts, Following), and a feed of blog post cards.
analysis.Purpose: To render and manage the blog posts area in a user’s profile, allowing viewing, filtering and creating posts.

Components.name: Tab
Components.responsibility: Renders a tab bar to switch between 'My posts', 'Drafts', 'Following' and binds selection to component state.

Components.name: Feed
Components.responsibility: Fetches and displays a list of blog posts with custom empty-state messaging and no load-more button.

Components.name: CardBlogpost
Components.responsibility: Displays individual blog post information in a card layout.

Functions.name: blog.read
Functions.description: Fetches blog posts from the store based on filter options.
Functions.parameters: options (object): { limit, category, period, status, user, creator, following }

Functions.name: watch(tabOrganization, callback)
Functions.description: Reacts to tab selection changes and updates the URL query parameter accordingly.
Functions.parameters: newValue (string): the newly selected tab value.

Functions.name: createButton@click handler
Functions.description: Navigates the user to the 'Create BlogPost' route when clicked.

analysis.Usage: Imported as a view component in the auth module’s routing configuration for a user’s profile page. Rendered when the route matches the blog posts subpage and receives route params and query for filtering.
Notes: No <style> section is defined in this file.
The ‘Create Post’ button and Tab component only render when the authenticated user’s ID matches the profile owner’s ID.
The component synchronizes its internal `tabOrganization` state with the URL query (`?tab=…`) via a watcher and router.replace.
Uses a scoped slot on <Feed> to render each item via <CardBlogpost>.
